## ScriptRegistry.resolveSourcePath() method

Resolves a logical id to a concrete source path and type by probing extensions.

Rules: - If `logicalId` ends with `.ts` or `.js`<!-- -->/`.mjs` and is a file, return it. - Else probe `logicalId.ts`<!-- -->, `logicalId.js`<!-- -->, `logicalId.mjs` in that order. - Maps `.mjs` to type `'js'`<!-- -->.

**Signature:**

```typescript
resolveSourcePath(logicalId: string): Promise<{
        type: "js" | "ts";
        path: string;
    }>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

logicalId


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The normalized logical module id (path-like).


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;{ type: "js" \| "ts"; path: string; }&gt;

`{ type, path }` or `null` if not found.
